answerText: Robert Burns [10] When Bertie calls his newt-loving friend Gussie Fink-Nottle a "poop," Jeeves responds that a "sensitive plant" would be more tactful. A poem of that name was written by this author of The Masque of Anarchy and "To a Skylark".
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC San Diego and Washington University and Chicago B | 10 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Bertie Wooster and his valet, Jeeves, are wont to make literary allusions.  [10] Because Bertie's plans often fail to work, Jeeves frequently quotes this poet's phrase: "the best laid plans of mice and men gang aft agley," much to Bertie's confusion.
